info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 1:20PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Hamilton and central Herkimer Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 120 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ohio, or 13 miles north of Little Falls, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dolgeville, Ohio, Newport, Poland, Cold Brook, Northwood, Russia, Norway, Nobleboro, Curtis, Burrell Corners, Wilmurt Corners, Shedd Corners, Morehouseville, Hoffmeister, Hurricane, Grant, Gray, Black Creek Reservoir and Wood Corners. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for eastern New York.
